Full press release: http://cleaver.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/congressmen-cleaver-and-jeffries-call-for-more-diversity-within-tech …
#CBCTech2020
Thanks to my cosigners: @RepJeffries @GKButterfield @RepBarbaraLee @MaxineWaters @RepEBJ @RepHankJohnson and #BennieThompson #CBCTech2020
This is not a game, it is the law. #CBCTech2020
It's alarming how many companies secure gov't contracts w/o any checks/balances on diversity efforts, plans, & supporting data. #CBCTech2020
We urge @USDOL to require gov't contracted tech companies to abide by fed regulations: develop written affirmative action plans #CBCTech2020
As of 2014, the % of African-Americans who work for tech companies whom hold sizable government contracts, was only 4.3%. #CBCTech2020
However, minorities hired by some of the largest tech companies in Silicon Valley are virtually non-existent. #CBCTech2020
According to @EdNCES, in 2012-2013 about 6,000 US African- American students earned computer & information science degrees. #CBCTech2020
African-Americans are majoring and graduating in computer science, they just aren’t being hired in reasonable numbers. #CBCTech2020
We’ve heard the excuse from some tech companies that there aren’t many African-American applicants, but that's not the case. #CBCTech2020
There's been growth in other industries in African American employment, but strong underrepresentation in the tech industry #CBCTech2020
Specifically, we're asking tech companies that hold sizable government contracts to develop written affirmative-action programs #CBCTech2020
Today @RepJeffries & I sent a letter to @LaborSec Perez calling for more diversity within the technology industry. #CBCTech2020

"God bless America!" @Pontifex finishes his address to Congress. #PopeInDC
"...so that as many young people as possible can inherit and dwell in a land which has inspired so many people to dream." #PopeInDC
"It is my desire that this spirit continue to develop and grow..." #PopeInDC @Pontifex
"the fruit of a faith which becomes dialogue and sows peace in the contemplative style of Thomas Merton." #PopeInDC
"...when it strives for justice and the cause of the oppressed, as Dorothy Day did by her tireless work" #PopeInDC
"when it fosters a culture which enables people to 'dream' of full rights for all their brothers & sisters, as MLK sought to do.." #PopeInDC
"A nation can be considered great when it defends liberty as Lincoln did..." #PopeInDC @Pontifex
"...throughout my visit the family should be a recurrent theme. How essential the family has been to the building of this country" #PopeInDC
"A good political leader always opts to initiate processes rather than possessing spaces." #civility #PopeInDC @Pontifex
"A good political leader is one who, with the interests of all in mind, seizes the moment in a spirit of openness and pragmatism." #PopeInDC
"I am convinced that we can make a difference, I am sure." #PopeInDC #climatechange @Pontifex
We need a conversation which includes everyone since the environmental challenge we are undergoing & its human roots concern & affect us all
"I would encourage you to keep in mind all those people around us who are trapped in a cycle of poverty. They too need to be given hope."
"How much has been done in these first years of the third millennium to raise people out of extreme poverty!" #PopeInDC
"The yardstick we use for others will be the yardstick which time will use for us." #PopeInDC @Pontifex #civility
"If we want security, let us give security; if we want life, let us give life; if we want opportunities, let us provide opportunities."
"Let us help others to grow, as we would like to be helped ourselves." #PopeInDC
Let us remember the Golden Rule: "Do unto others as you will have them do unto you." #PopeInDC @Pontifex
"We must...view [refugees] as persons, seeing their faces & listening to their stories, trying to respond as best we can to their situation"
"When the stranger in our midst appeals to us, we must not repeat the sins and the errors of the past." #immigration #PopeInDC @Pontifex
"I say this to you as the son of immigrants, knowing that so many of you are also descended from immigrants." #PopeInDC @Pontifex
"We, the people of this continent, are not fearful of foreigners, because most of us were once foreigners." #PopeInDC
"that of a community which sacrifices particular interests in order to share, in justice & peace, its goods, its interests, its social life"
"Politics is, instead, an expression of our compelling need to live as one, in order to build as one the greatest common good..." #PopeInDC
"All political activity must serve and promote the good of the human person and be based on respect for his or her dignity." #PopeInDC
"Our response must instead be one of hope and healing, of peace and justice." @Pontifex #PopeInDC
"Our world is increasingly a place of violent conflict, hatred & brutal atrocities, committed even in the name of God..." - @Pontifex

In case you missed my appearance this morning on @Morning_Joe: http://on.msnbc.com/1ygprPd  #Ferguson
We sacrifice the safety of others by creating chaos instead of pursuing a path to protect the rights of all Americans, regardless of color.
But violence, looting, and arson are not the answer. Not even close.
There are important issues in this country that need to be confronted, communicated, and worked through in the spirit of community.
Our heart goes out to Michael Brown's family for their tragic loss.
My wife and I have raised three sons, and we know the challenges a young, black man faces growing up.
This fight for justice, in #Ferguson and all over, demands far more firmness of purpose than a fight in the street.
This, however, is not the work of a moment but of a movement, and it will take a coalition, not a confrontation.
If they do not hear our cries in the street, let them hear us in the voting booth.
We wholeheartedly agree. Let us memorialize, but let us also mobilize. Let us change #Ferguson so that the entire nation would take note.
We have heard, with sympathetic ears, the frustrations and fears of young people. They have told us something must be done.
They will raise their voices. They will chant. They will preach. They will cry.
Tonight, many in #Ferguson will no doubt express their pain and angst publicly. They will raise their hands saying, hands up, don’t shoot.
We have not merely witnessed the effects of a warped sense of law & order, enforced with unbridled & unpredictable power. We wear the scars.
African-Americans have long believed that police resort to force incautiously when dealing with their young men.
We hear you. And we hurt with you. All decent Americans, black, white, brown, should also feel the pain of this family, this  community.
Remember, young people of #Ferguson, your pain is not wrong. Your feelings are valid. We understand you’re hurt.

Missouri would lose about $3,745,000 million to ensure clean water & air quality and prevent pollution from pesticides & hazardous waste.
Missouri would lose approximately $419,000 to help provide meals for seniors. #sequestration
Missouri could lose up to $127,000 to provide services to victims of domestic violence, resulting in up to 500 fewer victims being served.
In MO around 2500 fewer kids will receive vaccines for diseases (MMR, tetanus, whooping cough, influenza, & Hep B) due to reduced funding.
Up to 700 disadvantaged & vulnerable children could lose access to child care, which is also essential for working parents to hold down jobs
...as Missouri will lose about $758,000 for job search assistance, referral, and placement. #sequestration
Around 25,460 fewer Missourians will get the help and skills they need to find employment...

@DJNYC1 Most of these figures via: http://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/docs/sequester-factsheets/Missouri.pdf … More here: http://www.democrats.appropriations.house.gov/  http://www.nea.org/assets/docs/CBPP_Sequester_Impact_States.pdf#page=25 … http://www.harkin.senate.gov/documents/pdf/500ff3554f9ba.pdf …
...education, corrections & community corrections, drug treatment & enforcement, & crime victim & witness initiatives. #sequestration
Missouri will lose about $298,000 in Justice Assistance Grants that support law enforcement, prosecution & courts, crime prevention...
In MO, approximately 8,000 civilian Dept of Defense employees would be furloughed, reducing gross pay by about $40.3 million in total.
In addition, the Missouri State Department of Public Health will lose about $211,000 resulting in around 5300 fewer HIV tests.#sequestration
MO will also lose $1.3million in grants to help prevent & treat substance abuse, resulting in 3300 fewer admissions to treatment programs.
...natural disasters, and biological, chemical, nuclear, and radiological events. #sequestration
Missouri will lose approximately $572,000 to help upgrade its ability to respond to public health threats including infectious diseases...
Head Start & Early Head Start services would be eliminated for approx 1200 children in MO, reducing access to critical early education.
In addition, around 750 fewer students will get work-study jobs that help them pay for college. #sequestration
Around 1,280 fewer low income students in Missouri would receive aid to help them finance the costs of college. #sequestration
Missouri will lose approximately $10.8 million for about 130 teachers, aides, and staff who help children with disabilities.
In addition about 17,000 fewer students would be served and approximately 60 fewer schools would receive funding.
Missouri will lose approximately $11.9 million for primary and secondary education, putting around 160 teacher and aide jobs at risk.
#Sequestration’s impact will be felt across #MO05, #Missouri, and all of our nation. There's no time to waste.

@KokujinKun #FHA has made changes to its programs recently, from increasing cash reserves to upping standards for mortgages it insures.
#FHA has access to an unlimited line of credit with the Treasury, but it has never had to draw upon those funds.
The #FHA uses insurance fees as its sole source of revenue--not taxpayer $.
The #FHA is countercyclical-- its role increases when the economy is weakening, and it decreases when the economy is strengthening.
The #FHA was established in 1934 to help promote long-term stability in the U.S. housing market.
According to Mark Zandi, w/o #FHA, home prices would've declined an additional 25%, further harming borrowers & communities.

Designating the Liberty Memorial as the nation’s memorial to the veterans of The Great War recognizes the service and sacrifice of WWI.
In 1998 the community again stood in support of the Liberty Memorial by passing and paying a half-cent sales tax for 18 months.
On November 1, 1921, the supreme Allied commanders spoke to a crowd of more than 100,000 people. Pres. Coolidge dedicated the Memorial.
After WWI, in 1919, the citizens of KC organized and, led by the Liberty Memorial Association, raised over $2.5 million in 10 days.

Because of healthcare, millions of seniors are getting free preventive services.
For all Americans, Republicans and Democrats,we must continue to work together to make sure healthcare is functional, full, and fair.

The #countdown is on, but we still have time to act in the best interests of our  constituents, by passing a REAL transportation bill.
1...We could save each American family up to $1,060 in transportation costs, if we could come to an agreement. #countdown
2...We have 2.2 million construction and manufacturing workers out of work. #countdown
3...3 months ago, Senate passed a responsible, bipartisan 2-year transportation bill that would save/create over 2 million jobs. #countdown
Tune into @KMBZnews now to hear me chat with @KrisKetz and @RadioDana
4...4 million mi of public roads, 600k bridges, 5k transit systems, all in need of repair, reinvestment, and revitalization. #countdown
5...America used to rank 5th in the world in infrastructure quality, but now we have fallen far behind all the way to 24th place. #countdown
6...Some are pushing 6-month extension, but this will hurt the Highway Trust Fund, and cause states to cutback on investments. #countdown.
7...@RayLaHood said H.R. 7 was “the most partisan transportation bill that [he had] ever seen…the worst transportation bill..."  #countdown
8...8.2% is where our unemployment rate currently stands, too high, for far too long, and for far too many. #countdown
9...$94 billion a year is the gap between what we spend and what we need to invest in surface transpo, according to @ASCEGovRel #countdown
10...Ten is the number of short term extensions we, as lawmakers, have approved to a transportation bill from 2009. #countdown
Unless we can prevail over pathological partisanship, the clock will run out. The countdown has begun, and the numbers speak for themselves.
Instead of recessing again, we should stay in DC, work together, & pass a real, robust transportation bill to create jobs in MO05 & in USA.
Meanwhile, we have only a few days until highway & transit programs expire, endangering our roads, bridges, transit, and all who use them.

Spending cuts but no revenue increases? My constituents called, e-mailed my office asking for balance.

This debt deal is antithetical to everything the great religions of the world teach, which is take care of the poor, aged,  vulnerable.
This deal is a sugar-coated satan sandwich. If you lift the bun, you will not like what you see.
